description: monochrome image of an alter (or tomb?) that features a framed, 3/4 portrait of the virgin and child; many putti with wings surround the portrait, one putto sits along bottom of architectural feature and points toward drapery at bottom center
provenance: John E. Andrus III [Minneapolis, 1909-2012]; by descent to his daughter Catherine Andrus [Minneapolis]
text: This may look like an old print of the Virgin and Child, but it’s a painting meant to fool you slightly. We might do a double take thinking it’s an old print stuck on a wall and slightly curling at the edges. English uses a borrowed French term for this type of picture: "Trompe l’oeil"—literally, trick the eye.
title: Virgin and Child
